comment: If this course is mandatory you are in for a ride but you can do it! You'll  be miserable but it'll be okay. It'll make you stronger academically. Quizzes are difficult & short. Long and tedious lectures that very seldomly relates to quiz. So much content with no direction. I hate that I had to endure it but I'm glad that I went through it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: HORRIBLE professor! Do NOT take him during a summer semester. I am spending 10 hours per day on his ONE CLASS with a new module every other day.  He clearly has underlying sociopathic tendencies.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: DO NOT TAKE. you have to buy the textbook. the readings are long. the quizzes have nothing to do with what you read. an A is almost unachievable. save your mental health and stress. DO NOT TAKE
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took his class online and it was simple. A lot of easy discussion posts and 2 exams (midterm and a final). He's quick with responding to emails too. He's a good professor and it's a good online option; not too much work.

Good professor he makes sure that you're able to understand what he is asking. This class is lecture heavy so be sure to take notes and study them in advance. Overall great professor he's very caring and understanding!!

His syllabus looks much scarier than the course actually is. Very textbook heavy! About 6, on average, readings each week. The weekly quizzes are what is hardest in this course. They range from 3-7 questions and are quite difficult. His lectures are nice, but still do not help a lot when it comes to quizzes.

Requires the textbook and expects you to read it, but he links videos of the author providing a more detailed lecture. Often records his own lectures. Links articles based on the subject matter to read and use on your discussion post, which is going to be most of your grade beside quizzes. Not a difficult class.. Everything is open note.

Dr. Crombez is caring and very intelligent. His lectures were informative, so if you're actually interested in the topic he has a lot to teach you. I had him in-person; it seems like his online courses are not as great.. so take that with a grain of salt. You will have to read, but you will be fine! I thoroughly enjoyed his course and lectures.

A scathing review isn't enough. My first withdrawn class. Mental health suffered; graduation is delayed. 8 hours min of weekly work not relevant to the quizzes. Confusing wording for everything. 1/2 credit for misspelled word on FITB. Cocky. Lockdown recorded quizzes. Changed the syllabus. Presidents list student & I failed nearly everything. AVOID
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Prof Crombez cares a LOT. Could be a good thing, but much of his incoherent lecture material and readings are unrelated to the material on quizzes, not to mention the lack of an updated syllabus that is incredibly misleading on what the quizzes will include. Arrogant, smarter-than-his-students attitude. Highly recommend finding ANY other class.

The worst professor for social theory. It should never be this difficult. Many students never get As despite checking off everything he asked for. Videos and readings don't help with quizzes. Prepare to go above and beyond and make this class top priority. He says it's multiple choice but then makes it fill in the blank.

Skip this class if you can. Material does not add up with quizzes/tests. You have to buy the textbook. Long readings and lengthy lecture videos. He's a harda$$. Avoid at all costs, these reviews are so misleading to how he actually is. He stated you will basically not get an A even if you do everything correctly. Not risking my GPA
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Absolutely no comment. Just avoid this professor and his courses, your mental health and school experience will thank you extensively.
Great professor. So caring and helpful, makes it easy to succeed. 100% reccomend.

This class will change how you view the world. Prof. Crombez is an excellent teacher - the readings are dense, but his lectures make everything clear. Two brief papers, a quiz for each module and a handful of discussion boards - very fair grader. Would not recommend for summer course if you work full time, the reading can be a lot
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is AMAZING! He provides great resources and awesome lectures. The lectures and readings can be long, but he does a great job of breaking them up. I took this as a 4 week summer course and it was a healthy pace of coursework. Definitely not as overwhelming as other short courses. I will absolutely sign up for more classes with him.

really nice professor! the workload wasn't too bad; sometimes long readings and videos, but not too difficult. grading can be a little tough, but if you follow directions and think deeply you'll be okay. through his lectures and material given, you'll understand concepts very well.

I cannot recommend this professor enough! I have already signed up for another one of his classes for next semester. He is a super fair grader, and he makes all of the assigned coursework interesting which makes it feel far less like work! In addition, he is extremely kind and acknowledges the hard work that students put in.

Dr. Crombez is a good and nice professor. He doesn't use PPT for lectures and just talks so make sure you pay attention. Weekly discussions, quizzes, a paper and a final. Beware the readings are confusing and he only gets to the point at the end of class. If you aren't interested in reading essays from the 19th century than I would not recommend!

Dr. Crombez's courses in general requires reading from outside sources as well as textbooks and will reference the book quite often. Overall, he is a great professor that cares about his students, encourages but doesn't force class discussion, is very detailed about paper (only 2) formatting, style, and type of content needed to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He's the best! He truly cares about his students!

He is really cool and has interesting lectures. There is a lot of reading but if you go to class his lectures summarize it well. There are writings and discussions but as long as you put your own thoughts into them you will get a good grade. His grading is not tough and he seems to really care about us and just wants us to enjoy the class.

I have had professor Crombez for three courses at KSU, one online and two in person and he has been my favorite professor thus far. His teaching style is mostly lecture based but he basically gives an overview and goes into depth on the readings we are supposed to do the night before. The class is very reading heavy but he goes over everything!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: The only "bad" thing I can say is that the homework load was kinda heavy, other than that he is awesome! Made the class very fun, interesting topics. Don't be afraid to read, and write a lot!

I took him for intro to sociology honors and I would definitely recommend taking him any chance you get! There is a lot of reading and lectures but a lot of stuff is open note so as long as you pay attention you should do well! He is also very kind and cares about what's going on in your personal life so don't hesitate to reach out to him!

Very passionate & amazing lectures that shifted my worldview. But, a LOT of reading. 3 required textbooks, weekly articles/discussion posts/videos. Do the work, otherwise midterm/final will eat you. Participate in class. Very accessible contacting. 2 required projects. Extra credit if you never miss class. Permitted 1 unexcused absence. Lots of HW.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: I took this as a hybrid class. We had IP classes M & W and HW due on F. There are 3 textbooks, two can be found free online and one is $15. There is a lot of homework, but the class is taught well and the prof includes students a lot. You can tell the prof cares about his students, he is very kind and understanding. My fav class this semester!

This class was awesome. A lot of students didn't participate, but I learned a lot. Some career stuff that is really only for younger students, but the critical thinking stuff was great. Professor was excellent.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: This class was useless for me but was mandatory. Life experience should have allowed me to skip this course. This professor was all over the place & it felt like he made things up as he went along. The midterm was obnoxiously intense and the final was a little confusing and so long. He is passionate about sociology but this class has turned me away
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I have taken this teacher twice, both time receiving an A. However, this teacher is not the best. I have not really learned anything. His lectures are a bit all over the place and hard to follow. His quizzes are hard and you arent given a lot of time. He does not test. Massive midterm and final paper. A LOT of reading.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Saw odd info about this course out there. It's a required one for the major. It's on career goals and how to be a better student. There are weekly assignments, but the readings are all super short and easy. The midterm and final are in the same weeks as all classes, but professor Crombez broke it up so we could work on it throughout the semester.

I took this class as a prereq and there is so much overwhelming work. Reading, mandatory meetings for an online class, heavy finals. Some of the assignments are posted with only a few days to complete which most included lots of reading. Not a lot of reasonable time between midterm -final. If you already have a career this won't benefit you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Professor Crombez is honestly one of the best professors I've ever had. He is very knowledgeable about his field of study. Discussion boards are a main part of your grade, but they are very fun and get you to really think about real things in the world. He is always willing to give feedback and his grade system is very structured and well layed out

i failed this class cause im a idiot and didnt turn stuff in, but the prof tried to help me pass to the end. he def cares about you and puts mad effort into the class. i learned a lot, just got lazy and hated life this semester
Tough class, awesome professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: This class isn't easy if you slack so turn around here. He is a great professor though and he knows what he is teaching. There is no such thing as a wrong answer. If you fail all the quizzes but do great on your writing assignments you will probably get a B. Lots of reading though and discussions but he is a great person.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: An overall great professor. He takes the time to actually make lecture videos and you can tell he really cares about the content that we are learning. The class itself is very interesting and he has a way of giving assignments that really get you thinking. Be careful though. He has a midterm and a final, and they impact your grade hard. Study! 8/10
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is super hard, but surprisingly I'm really loving it. Professor Crombe is really kind and makes it interesting. He helped me when I needed extra help too. Will try to take him again.
Excellent professor. He knows how society functions and explains how Capitalists take advantage of the lower class. Makes you think critically about this world and realize very important facts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This was a shortened summer term class. Lots of work, but it was inspiring and life changing. I've never had a professor make me feel like they cared as much as Dr. Crombez. Take his course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Took this class last semester and am seriously missing it this semester especially with everything going on in the world right now. The class depressed and inspired me. This guy knows his stuff and you won't have another class at KSU like this.

This class was really tough and I didn't do as well as I wanted, but I learned more than I probably did in any other class here. Plus he's just a really sweet and nice guy. I'd take him again, but would take better notes if I did.

Dr. Crombez's course was incredible. I learned so much. Lots of reading and it was hard, but totally worth it in the end. He's very kind and understanding, but has high expectations of everyone. It was my last semester otherwise I would have tried to take more with him.

Loved this professor and class. Lectures and activities made it worth going to class. Easy part of grade with attendance, he even gave extra attendance points to the whole class at the end of the semester. Hoping to take him again.

This professor was my favorite this semester, his lectures are interesting and you can tell he's passionate about the subject. The class was an easy A, grades consisted of online quizzes (very easy; use quizlet), attendance, midterm, and a final.

Professor Crombez was a really nice guy, overall he was cheery and really seemed to care about his students. The material was pretty if you study for two hours before each test you should get at least a B. The Midterm is worth 25%, the final is worth 30%, homework due before each class adds up to 30%, attendance and participation are the rest.

I only took this class b/c I needed It as a preresiquite. The class is very boring. Revel quizzes, midterm, & final are easy & fair but you will fail attendance if you miss more than 3 classes b/c although in the syllabus It says you can miss 3 w/o penalty, as soon as you miss 4 he counts It as 6 & you end up w a 25% attendance grade Lol....
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Very nice guy and easy enough class. You have to get the online textbook and he expects you to get it like the first day. Online quizzes are due before every class but theyre not too hard and will help you on the tests (theres only one and the final). If you do those and look over them before the tests youll do fine.

His lectures started off kind of boring, but as the semester progressed he definitely incorporated more activities and discussions. There is reading and a quiz due before every class period, but they are very easy to complete. His tests are straightforward, and he is overall a happy/cheery guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things
